    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuizScreen()
      This is the constructor of the QuizScreen class which sets up the dimensions, background colour, initial buttons, the pane, where it starts off (location) in the screen, and also adds a window listener.

      This is the method that reads from a file and loads the screen components such as the question, true and false buttons, and along with setting the fonts used.

      This method remove the function of the true and false buttons after the player selects his or her choice.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuizScreen

        public QuizScreen()
        This is the constructor of the QuizScreen class which sets up the dimensions, background colour, initial buttons, the pane, where it starts off (location) in the screen, and also adds a window listener.

    • Method Detail

      • initLabels

        public void initLabels()
        Initializes all the labels and buttons with their pictures, along with rollovers. ActionCommands and ActionListeners are also added here.

        Variable Dictionary: Reference, Type, Purpose

        • trueImg, ImageIcon, holds the true button image
        • trueRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the true button rollover image
        • falseImg, ImageIcon, holds the false button image
        • falseRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the false button rollover image
        • continueImg, ImageIcon, holds the continue button image
        • continueRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the continue button rollover image
        Parameters:
        e - Nullpointer Exception reference

      • loadQuizScreen

        public void loadQuizScreen()
        This is the method that reads from a file and loads the screen components such as the question, true and false buttons, and along with setting the fonts used. Button relative locations are also set up here. Math.random() is used to generate a random question each time.
        Parameters:
        font - Font reference variable, bigger font used.
        font2 - Font reference variable, smaller font used.
        questionNumber - int storing which question is being asked.
        question1 - JLabel reference for the question selected to be asked.
        read - Scanner reference variable.
        e - Exception reference variable.

      • removeTrueFalseOptions

        public void removeTrueFalseOptions()
        This method remove the function of the true and false buttons after the player selects his or her choice.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This is the actionPerformed class which contains all of the commands each button do when pressed. If the answer selected and the correct answer match, the player gains bone marrow and score. If the answer selected is incorrect, the user gains nothing but a message is still shown. Else, the continue button would be clicked and that would continue on into the next stage of the game.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent reference variable.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        This method returns if done is true or false. If done the window will close and go back to the game screen's window.
